div.a: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 717 Greece, northern?, c. 1900 Burial: mid 4th cent. B.C.? (T) Contents: AR. Large hoard Aenus: tetradr.?, fr. Disposition: Berlin; Paris (cf. RN 1905, pp. 467-9, illus.); London (cf. NC 1905, pp. 329-31, illus.); Copenhagen; Cambridge Strack, AMNG II.1, p. 134 A letter from E. J. P. Raven (Oct. 3, 1951) suggests that some of the coins, chiefly fr., acquired in the 1900's by the cabinets above came from Lam- bros as did a number of pieces at Copenhagen
